item.title: The subtle art of saying no
item.description: I’ve been wondering a lot about the importance of saying no recently: Personally I’ve been trying to focus on important things and say no to other stuff that ends up consuming a lot of energy but is not that relevant. Professionally as a Product Owner I got to say no a lot ! actually I think the art to say no is one of the most important characteristics of a good PO.

item.title: In the end it's all about the people
item.description: I really like this article I’ve read in Increment The epistemology of software quality Say you run a new team. You have carte blanche to implement any policies you want to make the team more productive and the code less buggy. What do you do? You could choose a new programming language, or switch everything to microservices, or follow the hottest trend in process. Or you could do things that matter.
